subject: Fashion
title: Three-Piece Suit Origins
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Three-Piece Suit Origins.

hook.text: In 1666, King Charles II walked into court wearing a strange new outfit: a vest under a coat.

buildup.text: He was copying Persian styles he'd seen during his exile. The court was stunned.

discovery.text: Samuel Pepys noted the exact date in his diary: October 15, 1666. The three-piece suit was born.

twist.text: Charles did it partly to annoy France. Louis XIV had been dictating fashion, and Charles wanted out.

climax.text: A political act of rebellion became the most enduring garment in Western men's fashion history.

punchline.text: The suit was born as a political statement.

quiz.question: Why did King Charles II introduce the three-piece suit?
options: It was partly to rebel against French fashion dominance
He lost a bet with his tailor and had to wear it publicly
Doctors recommended layered clothing to prevent plague
